lines.content: * Main function that is run when this Java file is compiled and executed.
* Orchestrates the operation of Juke by accepting commands and dispatching
* them to the correct target methods.
/** Separator used by the virtual assistant to demarcate the start or end of a conversation */
* Juke Logo made from ASCII Art. Credits go to:
/** Introductory statement used by the assistant when first booting up. */
private static final String INTRO = "What's up! My name is Juke (J|ava D|uke) and I will be your personal\n" +
"assistant for today! How may I assist you?";
/** The Virtual Assistant's output CLI prompt. */

* Method that begins the operation of the Assistant.
* Dispatches the command and acts on it.
// parse the action into a JukeAction object
// act on it, or any other future generated actions
* Class that helps to parse the commands given by the user.
* This parser may not be instantiated. All methods are exposed via
public abstract class JukeParser extends JukeObject {
/** String regex for splitting a command by spaces. */
/** String regex for checking a command by "/by". */
/** String regex for splitting a command by "/by". */
/** String regex for checking a command for "/from" and "/to". */
/** String regex for splitting a command by "/from" and "/to". */
* Parse a command by a space. This method is used to obtain the first command in the command chain.
* @return Parsed array of Strings which represents the tokens in the command.
* Parse a command by the String "/by". This method is to be invoked only on a cleaned String where
* the first starting command is discarded.
* @return Parsed array of String which represents the parsed tokens in the command
* Parse a command by the String "/from" and "/to. This method is to be invoked only on a
* cleaned String where the first starting command is discarded.
* @return Parsed array of String which represents the parsed tokens in the command
* A manager of JukeTasks. This class handles the addition/deletion/manipulation of
* other child JukeTasks subsumed under its control.

* Abstract class used to dispatch commands to the respective actions.
public abstract class JukeAction extends JukeObject {
* Creates the specified JukeAction of interest.
* @param command Raw command from the user input
* @param taskManager JukeTaskManager object which manages all tasks.
public static final JukeAction of(String command, JukeTaskManager taskManager) throws JukeException {
* Dispatches the commands to the necessary subclasses of JukeAction.
* @param taskManager JukeTaskManager object which manages all tasks.
private static JukeAction dispatch(String[] args, JukeTaskManager taskManager) throws JukeException {
throw new JukeException("Oh no! No commands are present!");
throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your mark command!",

throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your unmark command!",

throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your delete command!",

throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your todo command!",
throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your deadline command!",
throw new JukeIllegalArgumentException("Oh no! I cannot understand your event command!",
JukeTask jt = new JukeEvent(parsedArguments[0], parsedArguments[1], parsedArguments[2]);
// checks if there are any operational errors
// note that this behaves similar to exceptions, in that older exceptions are overwritten by
throw new JukeException("Oh no! I do not understand that command!");
* Necessary method that is invoked when the action is carried out.
* @return Optional<? extends JukeAction> object, which contains further action objects,
* made this way to ensure that actions can call other actions and thus lead to chains
abstract public void complete() throws JukeException;
* Action that adds a Task to the Task Manager.
* Necessary method that is invoked when the action is carried out.
* @return Optional<? extends JukeAction> object, which contains further action objects,
* made this way to ensure that actions can call other actions and thus lead to chains
throw new JukeException("Oops! We cannot add the task of interest to your task list!");
* Action that deletes a Task from the Task Manager.

public JukeEvent(String taskName, String start, String end) {

* Abstract Class that represents a task that the user adds to Juke.

throw new JukeException("Oh no! The task selected is already completed!");
* @return {@code Optional<? extends JukeAction>} for further actions to take
throw new JukeException("The task selected is already not completed!");
